data.title: Sports Management Worldwide Testimonials
data.text:
Mzava Sports CEO

Enrolling in the FIFA Exam Preparation Course with SMWW was one of the best decisions I've made for my career in sports management. The course guided me through comprehensive insights into FIFA regulations, governance structures, and disciplinary processes. Under the guidance of experienced instructors and fellow students, I gained a deep understanding of the complexities of FIFA's operations and the principles of ethical conduct in sports governance. The interactive learning environment, (weekly assignments, two minutes drill questions, video chats) helped me gain knowledge and skills to prepare effectively for the FIFA exam. I highly recommend the FIFA Exam Preparation Course with SMWW to anyone seeking to advance their career in sports management and enhance their understanding of FIFA regulations and governance

FIFA Agent FAQ

Senior Advisor

In my opinion and my experience, the most benefit of having this course is as follows: 1- The online course is convenient for most people. 2- Having candidates from different cultures and backgrounds. 3- The video chat is so exciting for having different points of view from different cultures. 4- the flow of information I gained from both experienced professionals Dr. Mushtaque and Dr. Lashbrook. I appreciate the time and effort they gave to us.

Sports Administration

NFLPA Agent

I would like to thank SMWW for offering the NFLPA Exam Prep course which prepared me to successfully pass the exam. I am so thankful that I was able to find SMWW and for putting me in a position to accomplish a goal I have worked very hard to attain! Joel prepares students to tackle the exam with the questions he provides as well as providing the reasoning for the answers. Now, it is on the student to retain the material and be able to recognize it when seeing it on the test but he and the course give you the best chance for success. All the student has to do is put in the work. I am beyond excited to state that by the end of the month I will be a certified/licensed NFLPA Contract Advisor! Thank you!

Football Agent Certification Prep

The things that I learned from this course are that networking is a lot bigger deal than I realized. I learned how to write scouting reports and get really good feedback on them as to what I need to work on and it's nice knowing that I can make mistakes and learn from them here instead of making them later. I also know that thanks to this course I will be further along than a lot of the people in my position.

Baseball General Manager and Scouting

President New King Multimedia Group LLC

My purpose and goal for taking this course were to enhance my basketball knowledge beyond pure skill and on-court training. Internally I knew that I wanted to be involved with the game I felt/feel so passionate about, but I had no idea how to begin. In no way did I realize by taking this course would enable me to talk to people I have admired for so many years. For many years I have wondered what and how executives made their decisions on a player. Talking to current and former NBA scouts learning the intangibles with a player on how to make yourself target for the next level. This course has been nothing short of excellent.

Basketball General Manager and Scouting

Student-CSU San Marcos

I loved the informational interviews as it was a great way to put myself out there and take my first steps into the professional side of baseball. I particularly loved it because it made us (students) go above and beyond and pushed ourselves to keep trying until we were successful. It taught me that you need to be persistent and never give up if you want to work in any sport. I had interviews that went very successful as I learned a lot from them and am forever grateful for SMWW for this opportunity.

Baseball Analytics

Texas Rangers Catcher

I won't lie I was skeptical coming into the course, but I was truly blown away by the amount of information I learned in 8 WEEKS! The Player Development course run by Dan himself has taught me a lot, even with the knowledge I have been a player in professional baseball. You will learn the ins and outs of what goes on in player development and some key tools to take with you into your coaching or front-office career! I feel 100x more confident about how to create a well ran organization.

Baseball Player Development & Strategy

French Professional Hockey Player

I am very satisfied with the SMWW Experience. SMWW provides unique ways to expand your knowledge in the Business you are interested to work in and gives you the opportunity to become an expert with specific knowledge you can only have by following an SMWW Course. Mentors like Harry Sinden, Mike Oke, Dino Caputo, and Claire Cornish are very relevant if you want to understand the Sector and ask questions. The organization and the tools provided (books, expert insights, videos) are very useful to study. SMWW is the best Online Studying Platform I experimented with!

Hockey General Manager and Scouting

Martin Luther College (D-III) Sports Information Director

The SMWW/NetScouts apprenticeship program provided a big opportunity for me to grow as a scout and as an individual looking to break into the basketball industry. The program gives you the hands on experience to live scout D-I basketball games and enhance your skills as a writer. There, you had your articles published to the NetScouts site where you wouldnt normally be able to do on your own. The part of the apprenticeship that may get overlooked is the weekly chats and the chance to interact with college or international basketball coaches/scouts. That proved to be very valuable and gave insight into the industry that I aspired to join. Having taken the apprenticeship twice, I learned a great deal on analyzing and evaluating players and teams. Carl genuinely wants to see you succeed and he gave me support and mentorship throughout the program.

Basketball Apprenticeship

Jareed Askew

The video editing course with Synergy allowed me to gain access to a very important technology that is used throughout the basketball world. I learned how to put together Player personnel, and opponent scouting edits. I also learned what a string is and how NBA teams use it. I believe this course will be very helpful for my career as I now know how to use one of the most used technologies in the industry which a lot of people can not get access to unless they work/worked for a professional team or college team.

Basketball Video Performance Analysis With Synergy

Wanda Tatum

Sports Worldwide Management is a great educational opportunity for individuals that are interested in learning how to break off into the sports industry. I highly recommend that anyone who is interested in working in the sports industry SMWW is certainly the place for you to get the entry level skills that can open the doors with your own ambitions and the wonderful curriculum that Dr.Lashbrook (Founder of SMWW) has put together for you to obtain your dream career in the industry of Sports in many fields offered . I absolutely would recommend to contact SMWW and your on your way to achieve your goals

Athlete Marketing and Branding

The biggest thing I learned from the GM & Scouting class is how important building connections & relationships and putting yourself out there is to not only getting your foot in the door but lasting in this industry really is. For the most part, all of us have the tools to scout. We can sharpen those tools and learn different things, but without the relationships and understanding the makeup of players and colleagues it is a tough hill to climb to be successful. This course has provided me the ability to get my name out there and I have been able to connect with scouts and front office personnel throughout the baseball industry, and it has even led to opportunities in my area

Baseball General Manager and Scouting

Pro Level Sports Agency Senior Vice President

In a nutshell, taking courses here at SMWW have giving me the opportunity to network with current and future Sports Agents and Sports Business men and women who are already making an impact in the industry. Due to my connection with SMWW, I've connected with a former classmate, who owns an agency, where I started as an Agent Advisor and have been promoted to Senior Vice President of Business Operations. I feel attending SMWW will place women of sports in a greater position to succeed and flourish in a male dominated industry. Thank you so much, SMWW for being the wind beneath my wings. And for showing me, the sky is no longer the limit. Go beyond those limits and soar!

Athlete Marketing and Branding

SMWW is a great resource for anyone wondering if they have what it takes to break into the wide world of professional sports. The two courses I took (Baseball GM & Scouting, Baseball Analytics) helped me realize what I love about the game, how I want to be involved in the industry, and where I can look to achieve those goals. They do all this with a very human flair - one that encourages you to step out of your comfort zone while welcoming you as part of the SMWW family

Baseball General Manager and ScoutingBaseball GM Course Testimonials

NFLPA Certified Agent

Anyone sitting for the NFLPA exam should enroll in this course. I could not have passed the exam without the course. After sitting through each session and going over the problems, my study partners and I dissected each problem and reworked them to fully understand each concept. Everything finally clicked after re-listening to the recorded sessions and reworking the problems. Joel was most helpful and open to explaining everything to ensure full understanding. The class is was worth every penny spent on it.

Football Agent Certification Prep

SoDo Mojo Writer

I took the Baseball GM and Scouting course at 17 years old with Dan Evans and Hank Jones and it was an incredible experience. I learned so much from them and I have been able to use what I learned to help me get going in my young career. I hope to take more SMWW classes and attend more events.

Baseball General Manager and Scouting

Director of Rugby at Edinburgh Academicals

This course took my knowledge and understanding to the next level. The course content will get you thinking outside the box and looking at how you can put your learning into your current setting. It is a must if you are looking to excel in your career in the business end of Rugby, but I would advise anyone involved in Rugby Admin or within Rugby Operations to take this course as it will better you and the club you are involved in.

Mick and John are great throughout the 8 weeks with their weekly chats and as mentors to get advice from throughout.

Rugby Business Management

Senior Writer, TheHoosier.com (a Rivals.com website)

Learning under Carl Berman of NetScouts Basketball was an extremely valuable experience. Not only as a basketball evaluator but also with growing my writing capabilities. He helped me learn the ins and outs of the basketball industry and all of the details to look for when covering a team or a player. I would highly recommend getting involved with NetScouts and SMWW in any way you can. The connections and experience you gain will be invaluable.

Basketball Video Performance Analysis With SynergyBasketball AnalyticsBasketball Apprenticeship

LA Rams Analytics Intern

I would just like to thank you for the last 8 weeks through the course. It is the first time I have enjoyed studying in my life. You made it extremely interesting and made the learning process as smooth as possible. Your teaching has also given me even more motivation to make a career out of it, hopefully in the NFL!

Football AnalyticsData Science Analytics

Certified International Cricket Agent

The Cricket Business Course was diverse and comprehensive. It confirmed for me that this was a passion that I needed to pursue. I really appreciate that Ken has followed up on my career and offered advice. It is impossible to work in a vacuum and I think the way SMWW organizes online Zoom events is a great way to get students connected and motivated.

Thank you again to Ken for passing on my details. It is an honor to be considered and that he has made the connection. Ken is a very well respected and active stakeholder of cricket in Australia.

Cricket Business Management

I highly recommend SMWW's Athlete Branding and Marketing course taught by Kristen Kuliga. This course afforded me the opportunity to learn from the best. In the course, we tackled effective strategies for building sustainable athlete brands, networks, athlete-agent relationships, social media marketing, understanding endorsement deals, the new NIL bill and its impact on athletes, post-career entrepreneur ventures, and more. The best part of the course was NFL legend Doug Flutie stopping in to speak with the class, as he embodies that which we studied, a great athlete brand with a great story.

Athlete Marketing and Branding

OJHL Cobourg Courgars GM

The Hockey GM and Scouting course is a fantastic stepping stone for anyone that has ever wanted to get involved in hockey operations. From diving into the role of General Manager and building a roster, to what to look for when scouting players and building a draft list, this course will provide you with the opportunity to pursue hockey as a career. The weekly sessions with Harry Sinden, Dino Caputo, and Mike Oke gave us the opportunity to network with our peers and discuss the hot topics of hockey. I will be using the information, insight, and resources for years to come.

Hockey General Manager and Scouting

The course was honestly an amazing experience. The lecturers are arguably the best you would see around. They answered all the questions with examples. I learned how to connect and the importance of networking. In this business, let honesty be your hallmark. In this course, you will learn more than enough to be amongst the best.

Soccer Agent

Graduate Assistant Mens Basketball Coach, The Citadel

The NetScouts Basketball/SMWW apprenticeship program is a great opportunity for anyone with an interest in pursuing a career in basketball. Being a credentialed member on press row was a dream come true for me. You are given the tools to hone your skills of talent evaluation and get feedback on your reports about how to improve. Mr. Berman is hands on with his feedback and has a great deal of respect and experience in this business. While in the program, I attended several SOCON basketball games in my area and two years later I am now coaching in the same conference. Take advantage of this position by forming genuine relationships with as many people as you can

Basketball General Manager and ScoutingBasketball Video Performance Analysis With SynergyAlumni AssociationBasketball Apprenticeship

Perth Wildcats and Perth Lynx

If you need hands on experience scouting, including feedback and formatting reports, then NetScouts has an ideal option, with their in-depth scouting program. Having spent a full NCAA season scouting for them across the US, I had support the whole way. Entry into games, great seats and excellent advice. Now, with NetScouts teaming up with SMWW, they've gone to a new level. I highly recommend this program to anyone looking to start out in the basketball industry.

Basketball Video Performance Analysis With SynergySalary Cap Analysis & Contract NegotiationData Science AnalyticsBasketball Apprenticeship

Being an intermediary is something I have had interest in for a very long time, but I was reluctant to take the course, pay money, having it online and all. But after this course, I can say I am very pleased, I thought I knew a lot about dealing with players and the soccer agent job in a whole but SMWW has really been an eye opener. I loved everything about this course, the mentors were exceptional and my course mates were all good guys. If you want to get this course done, dont wait any longer, get on board now because what you take in will guide you in your quest to be an Agent forever.

Soccer Agent

I just want to say thank you for being such a great mentor to me and helping me achieve my goals. You really gave me some clarity and a path to follow and it has helped a ton! Taking that course was really the best investment in my life. I really appreciate you sharing your knowledge and direction.

Coaching At The Next Level

Dan Duquette's Player Development course is a brilliant addition to the SMWW baseball operations family of courses. Dan's 4 decades in baseball, primarily as a GM, provide students insight into player development that is unparalleled. The two time Sporting News Executive of the Year's course is the perfect complement to the SMWW Baseball GM and Scouting Course with former Dodgers GM Dan Evans/former Dodgers Scout Hank Jones, and the Baseball Analytics Course with baseball savant Ari Kaplan. These courses together are a triple threat for anyone to have under their belt if they aspire to work in baseball!

Baseball Player Development & Strategy

Hall of Fame Quarterback, San Francisco 49ers

Marc is a great football coach, he really is. Off the field, we have become friends over the years and I think very highly of him. On the field, he is very cerebral and thoughtful tactician. He is very smart, very patient, and very competitive. He is also very aggressive, yet he is never afraid to make tough calls.

Football Player Development & Strategy

Hall of Fame Coach, Minnesota Vikings

As a coach, Marc Trestman absorbs things very quickly and is able to put it into a proper perspective. He knows how to manage people and he really understands the game of football. He has brought it down to a simple denominator, He has realized that football is not as complicated as people like to think it is.

Football Player Development & Strategy

The Baseball GM/Scouting course was by far my favorite class that I have completed with SMWW. Hank Jones and Dan Evans provides tremendous information from their experiences and what really goes on within Baseball Operations Departments, takes you behind the scenes in scouting and teaches how to identify the top prospects with multiple tools. I feel very confident in the information that I have learned with this course and I am ready to use it first hand with an organization.

Baseball General Manager and Scouting

Calgary Video Scout

Alyssa, Since the NHL Draft Conference, it's been a game-changer to me. The amount of confidence I was able to obtain and how people think at your conference is on another level. I can't thank you, Dr. Lashbrook, and the rest of the SMWW team enough for changing my mentality and the opportunities Ive been given in hockey. Thanks to the conference, I will be working with a hockey academy in Calgary Alberta Canada this upcoming season. Thank you!

Hockey Career Conference at the NHL Draft

SMWW Alumni

This course was not only thought-provoking and informative to the changes in the way the game is assessed, viewed, and played, but also engaging and fun! I am lucky and blessed to have taken it and have had the chance to connect with Ari, Dan and Hank in the process. I strongly recommend anyone interested in the game to consider taking this course! For those of you sports fanatics with a growth mindset out there, SMWW checks all the boxes.

Baseball General Manager and ScoutingBaseball Analytics

The College of Idaho

Clarity. That is the word I would like to describe what I got from the conference. I knew what the path looks like - whether good or bad. There is no more wondering - I know what it takes and what is expected of me. And of course, I made many new friends and connections that I cant wait to follow up on.

Football Career Conference during the NFL Combine

MLB Player Agent

Dan is the real deal, hes worked in affiliated and independent baseball, has dealt with international signings and is well versed in all aspects of the business side of a baseball operation. He has run three MLB clubs and has dealt with all types of players from superstars to utility types, has been in charge of both scouting and player development areas and knows how to engage with ownership groups at the highest level. Having talked about all of the above, Dans best attributes are his understanding of a BB organization and knowing how to communicate with all levels of a sports organization. In addition, Torontos recent interest in his becoming their next President of BB Ops shows how esteemed Dan is, even by his competitors. Id recommend signing up for his course, a student will learn about theory but Dan will prepare you for what really happens in the sports world!

Welcome, Dan, to the SMWW family!

Baseball Player Development & Strategy

Toronto Blue Jays Interpreter

I am extremely happy to announce that I have accepted Shun Yamaguchi's Interpreter position with the Toronto Blue Jays and now heading to Tampa for Spring Training! If it wasn't for you guys, I wouldn't have made it to where I am for what I dreamed of.

Thank you for all the support you have given me and I hope I can be a good sample for those who are trying to pursue the same type of path as I do.

Baseball General Manager and Scouting

Franklin, Michigan

Thank you SMWW. I passed the exam and I felt extremely well about the material before and after the exam. During the test breaks, other testers were asking me questions.

All of that to say, Joel Corry was an outstanding instructor. I appreciate SMWW for such a great course. I also want to thank you, Alyssa, for the support you provided as well.

Football Agent Certification Prep

Menlo College, Men's Basketball Assistant Coach

Interning for NetScouts Basketball was a tremendous opportunity to get started in the basketball industry. I was able to learn from some of the best in the business and gain some real-world, practical experience in the field. Through this internship, I was provided with the opportunities to get out into the scouting world and add a respected organization to my resume. I would encourage those who have the opportunity to take full advantage and build as many meaningful relationships as possible through this program. It was a great way to break into the industry!

Basketball Apprenticeship

Hidden Gems Basketball Basketball Coach

Working as a scout trainee with NetScouts Basketball was the best decision that I have made thus far for my career. While at NetScouts I have gained very valuable experience of being a basketball scout. I have been able to take advantage of some unique opportunities such as working side-by-side with other scouts and journalists on media row while attending high-end Division 1 basketball games. Ive also been able to sharpen my skills by working on international scouting projects such as the Nordic and European championship games.

Basketball Apprenticeship

Director of Scouting, DMV Warriors (ABA)

NetScouts Basketballs scout training program has been an amazing part of my professional scouting journey. Through this program, I have learned the ins and outs of scouting and have been given the opportunity to do it in a professional setting. Being affiliated with NetScouts has given me credibility for my career and allowed me to show other organizations my professional worth. I recommend this to anyone interested in scouting, analytics, media relations or just basketball in general.

Basketball Apprenticeship

Babcock Hoops, Director of Scouting

NetScouts Basketball has been an integral part of my journey and stands out as one of the best opportunities in the world. The ability to watch high-level basketball at press row has helped me grow as a talent evaluator, as well as a connector. This training program has helped me develop my eye both on the court and through video scouting, while simultaneously introducing me to wonderful people around the NCAA & NBA communities. I highly recommend NetScouts to anyone aspiring to work in the realm of basketball.

Basketball Apprenticeship

Western New England University Graduate Assistant

NetScouts Basketball offers the only opportunity for aspiring scouts to gain meaningful experience scouting live Division 1 games at press row. The program enabled me to be credentialed for high-level college games and hone my scouting ability in a professional setting. Through this unique process, you will drastically improve your ability to evaluate players and assemble professional scouting reports. The scouting experience Ive gained with NetScouts has contributed directly to my professional development and has resulted in new career opportunities. I highly recommend the program to anyone interested in scouting or working in basketball at any level.

Basketball Apprenticeship

Full 8 Sports Marketing Owner

I started my own business in the Motorsports world hoping I could figure it out as I went. I did that for a while but needed another boost. As introverted as I am, I needed a push for networking in particular. SMWW gave me that push! With the focus of the class on networking within the industry, it made it easier to bring it into the real world. The class brought different aspects and a better understanding of the motorsports industry as a whole. I received some validation that what I was doing in my current business was the way that it was done which gave me more confidence in going out on my own. I would highly recommend this class for anyone who has a passion for motorsports. It doesn't matter if you know what you want to do within the industry, or if you are just exploring options!

Motorsports Management

I took the Hockey GM and Scouting Course iand it taught me the ins and outs of hockey as well as what to look for in a player. I started scouting in the North American 3 Hockey League for 5 years, the NAHL for 3 years and just hired on with the Madison Capitols in the United States Hockey League. Through the learnings of the course and connections Ive made along the way, I wouldnt be where I am today without SMWW. Also, I attended the NHL Draft which was a great networking event and I had the opportunity to share my progress and goals with Dr. Lashbrook.

Hockey General Manager and ScoutingHockey Career Conference at the NHL DraftHockey Agent

PGA Tough Tournament Operations Specialist

I always had the passion for baseball and was looking for a place to start. I had some doubts at the beginning but as I went through the 8 weeks, talking to actual MLB executives in the industry at a conference and attending the Winter Meetings, I was compelled. Dan not only taught me baseball operations but also guided me to the right people. Through Dan and this program, I connected with a bunch of MLB team executives which eventually lead me to interviews. From the connections that I made throughout, I ended up getting a job at PGA TOUR as a Tournament Operations Specialist.

Baseball General Manager and Scouting

G3 ProCamps Group Operations Coordinator

This course allowed me to reconnect with the spot I love in a different way than before. I work with professional athletes on a regular basis but this will help me to analyze what they do on the field more. I look forward to being able to use what I have learned during this course in the line of work I am in now. I also look forward to seeing what new opportunities having this course under my belt will bring me in the future.

Football Analytics

Head of Analysis and Assistant Director of Player Personnel

Sports Capology was a great experience. The chats were excellence and they taught me so much. The instructor treats you like a friend instead of a student which helps in your learning. He takes the time to explain things as well as listens to what you have to say. If your interested in the salary cap of any sport, this is the course that can teach you all about it.

Salary Cap Analysis & Contract Negotiation

I really enjoyed the conference. It was one of the best experiences I have ever had. It was worth the 9-plus hour drive for my family and I. The information that was provided was very beneficial to everyone. Learn from people who have years of experience is great. Its a great opportunity for people who want to work in sports.

Football Career Conference during the NFL Combine

I'm writing to you and the rest of your team to thank you! I took the Baseball GM & Scouting Course two years ago and I learned so many skills that have helped me in my career. In December 2018, on my second season has Toros de Herrera G.M. in the Panamanian professional Baseball League my team won the Championship. In January, we got the opportunity to play at the Latin American Baseball Series in Mexico where we finished third and during this series we got a call from the Commissioner of the Caribbean asking if Panama could host a Caribbean Series and get Toros to play in the tournament. Not only did we help them organize the series and were great hosts, but a team that I put together in four days with 15 Toros Players, and 6 Panamanians from other teams and seven players from the Nicaragua and Colombian league won the Series in what is one of the most incredible histories in modern Baseball. We competed against the best teams in the winter leagues and finished with a 4W - 1L record with historic victories against Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, and Cuba.

Thanks for your help and hope the programs keep going strong.

Baseball General Manager and Scouting

SMWW / NetScouts Apprentice

For those interested in getting experience in scouting, I fully endorse the SMWW/ Netscouts apprenticeship. One thing that holds people back from their dreams of working in professional basketball is actually getting the real work experience. Other SMWW classes allow aspiring basketball professionals to learn specific skills this program allows you to actually apply them. The media access that this apprenticeship provides is the real cherry on top, it gave me just what I needed, more access to the Raptor 905.

Basketball General Manager and Scouting

Rodgers State University Intro to Esports Instructor

I was just able to finish the esports business class this weekend. It is fantastic that SMWW has become one of the first groups in the United States to offer an academic course on esports. Im very thankful for the opportunity to be included in the first class session. The mentors have great industry knowledge and were good hosts for the video sessions. The Esports Business course is a great overview of esport team management and the fast-growing field of esports opportunities. Direct video conversations with the mentors are worth the time and effort.

Esports Business

I'm very proud to announce that I have formally accepted a Video Scout position with Baseball Info Solutions that I will be starting in March. Not going to lie, it's been a long year filled with a lot of doubt of whether I could even get a job baseball after a lot of rejection but I finally turned a dream that I had in high school into reality. Thank you to everyone who believed that I could make this happen even when I had my doubts. Also, a huge thank you to my mentors at Sports Management Worldwide Dan Evans and Ari Kaplan. I gained so much information from them and their guidance put me in position to make this happen. I'm excited to see where this takes me and I can't wait to get started!

Baseball General Manager and ScoutingBaseball Analytics

Manager

SMWW has exposed and opened up my knowledge of the sport Industry. I have been doing sport business casually, lacking the knowledge of what I am required to do and how to act during negotiations, approaching clubs and players. I encourage people who want a successful career to study with SMWW. I thought I knew it all but I was shocked to discover how little I know during the 8 weeks course. Thanks SMWW

Soccer AgentSoccer Analytics

Content Manager, Social Media Manager, & Scout

I took the Football GM and Scouting course over the summer and I loved everything about it. It taught me some insights of the league that I didn't know about. Our mentors, Russ Lande, Mark Dominik, and John Wooten were amazing and would answer any question that I had for my live chats. This course helped lay the foundation that I plan on turning into a career. If your wanting to learn more about being a GM and scouting in the NFL then I highly recommend taking this course.

Football General Manager and Scouting

During my class with SMWW I was able to learn numerous amounts of information on business development and ticket sales. After my class though I stayed heavily involved with SMWW through going to numerous conferences (NBA x2 & NHL) and helping to work them to make sure they were being run smoothly. The best advice that I got through SMWW and Mark Warkentein was to be 1% better each day than the last. If you are someone that is motivated to excel in any career of your choice I believe that SMWW will help prepare you not for just your career, but also you life.

Sports Sales and MarketingSports InternshipsVirtual Internship Program

SMWW gives you the chance to get your foot in the door in the competitive world of sports. I took the football GM and scouting course and it was an incredible experience, being able to talk to ESPN Analyst and former Tampa Bay Buccaneers GM Mark Dominik every week along with John Wooten, Russ Lande, and Dr. Lashbrook was absolutely awesome. You get out what you put in when it comes to the courses, so if you want to work in sports and you are committed to working your tail off than I would recommend SMWW to anyone.

Football General Manager and ScoutingSports Internships

I was in the same position as most college students. I was about to graduate with my degree, yet had no job prospects or an idea of where to start looking. I came across Dr. Lashbrook at a local restaurant here in Portland when he handed me his business card and told me to follow up. I went into the office a few days later and signed up that day to take the Sports Sales and Marketing Course. I also began to intern in the office a few times a week as my schedule permitted. Through SMWW and Dr. Lashbrook, I was able to dive deep into my sports career and look forward to progressing my career.

Sports Sales and MarketingSports Internships

Chicago Bulls Player Development Coordinator

As an SMWW alum of Basketball GM & Scouting, the Basketball Career Conference, and Sports Revenue Mgmt course, I am pleased to inform you that I have gotten my first NBA job with the Brooklyn Nets as Player Development and Video Assistant. I thank you for all of the knowledge and networking that SMWW has imparted to me to this point. Thank you again and I hope to continue to ascend the NBA ladder and represent your company well.

Basketball General Manager and Scouting

Entrepreneur and Attorney

Joel, I just found out I passed the NFLPA Certification exam, so I will be able to move forward with my NFL agent venture. I wanted to say thanks so much for your guidance and help in understanding the CBAyou MORE than prepared me! I really say this in a modest way, and complimentary to you, but the exam didnt seem that difficult and I believe part of the reason is because of how you helped me over-prepare, going through the most difficult scenarios.

Football Agent Certification Prep

I'm a student in Ari Kaplan's Baseball Analytics Class. We're about halfway through the course and I've already landed my first job in baseball! I logged into the course page last Sunday to post an assignment and I saw a message to all students from SMWW that the Tampa Bay Rays were hiring TrackMan and Pitch f/x Operators for their minor league affiliates. I quickly revised my resume to feature the course description that SMWW provided and applied for the job via TeamWork Online. The very next day I was hired by the Rays Baseball Operations Department to help run TrackMan for one of their minor league clubs that is local to me! They said my resume really stood out, and I attribute most of that to having the SMWW Baseball Analytics course description front and center. So I'd like to say 'thank you' to the whole SMWW crew and I look forward to continuing to study and learn with you. With this new job, my investment has already more than paid for itself. Thanks again, David Yamin

Baseball AnalyticsBaseball Player Development & Strategy

IF Bjrklven Hockey Allsvenskan Scout

I wanted to touch base with SMWW as I have been living in Sweden for the past sixteen months. I've been working as a full time scout with IF Bjrklven Hockey Allsvenskan since last September. Currently I am one of three full-time scouts in Swedish hockey.

I wanted thank Dr. Lashbrook and the staff at SMWW for all your help. This course has been both an awakening and an inspiration for me. Since I am a European, I never knew the way they played this game overseas. I was amazed at the amount of information about hockey that I hadn't known about. This course was one of my best experiences so far in the hockey world. I hope I can continue my journey after completing this course. This course introduced me to some new things and helped me to put the puzzle together, so to speak, on a number of issues. I gained a different outlook on the game and learned to train my eye much sharper than I ever did before. The weekly chats were invaluable. The Rink Net program was also enlightening. I was not aware there was a program that enabled you to follow every single player in the league. For the last eight weeks, I felt like a sponge who was soaking up every bit of information I could.
